Read and Process Participant Data from CSV

read_participants.Rd

This function reads a CSV file containing participant data, cleans and processes it, and returns a tidy data frame. It allows for flexible column naming and handles various CSV structures.

Usage

read_participants(
  path = system.file("participants.csv", package = "dividefair"),
  var_id = "id",
  var_age = "age",
  var_group = "group",
  var_adjustment = "adjustment",
  var_agegroup = "agegroup",
  indicator_costs = "cost_",
  value_adults = "adult",
  value_kids = "kid"
)

Arguments

path

A string. The file path to the CSV file.

var_id

A string. The name of the ID column in the CSV (default: "id").

var_age

A string. The name of the age column in the CSV (default: "age").

var_group

A string. The name of the group column in the CSV (default: "group").

var_adjustment

A string. The name of the adjustment column in the CSV (default: "adjustment").

var_agegroup

A string. The name of the age group column in the CSV (default: "agegroup").

indicator_costs

A string. The prefix for cost columns in the CSV (default: "cost_").

value_adults

A string. The value to use for adult age groups (default: "adult").

value_kids

A string. The value to use for kid age groups (default: "kid").

Value

A tibble (data frame) containing the processed participant data.

Details

The function performs the following operations:

  1. Reads the CSV file

  2. Cleans column names

  3. Renames columns based on user-provided names

  4. Processes the age group column, categorizing into adults and kids

  5. Pivots cost columns into a long format

Examples

data_participants <- read_participants()
